text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello my name is Carolina Bermudez a
technical account manager here at the
AWS office in San Jose Costa Rica today
I'm going to show you how to find a law
group that is causing a sudden increase
in your Amazon cloudwatch logs build
let's get started
you have several ways to check for the
Law Group that's causing the increase in
your bill you can check how much data
you are investing in a small set of log
groups using the cloud watch console you
can check a large set of log groups
using the cloud watch console and an API
call and finally you can review the
storage data through your AWS bill first
check how much data you are ingesting in
a small set of log groups let's query a
small set of log groups using the cloud
watch console open the cloudwatch
console
in the navigation pane choose metrics
all metrics
make sure that you are in the correct
region
enter incoming bytes in the search box
the incoming bytes metric shows you how
much data is being ingested in your
Cloud watch log groups in near real time
and which log group is the highest
contributor towards your bill
choose logs log group metrics
you'll see the log groups list of that
region
check the log group that you want to
query from the list
choose the graphed metrics tab
for statistic choose Zoom
for period choose 30 days
choose the options Tab and then choose
number
at the top right of the graph choose
custom and then choose absolute
select the start and end date that
corresponds with the last 30 days
you can now see the incoming bytes of
that Law Group
check how much data that you are
ingesting in a large set of log groups
now let's query a large set of log
groups using the cloudwatch console
open the cloud watch console
in the navigation pane choose metrics
all metrics
make sure that you are in the correct
region
enter incoming bytes in the search box
choose logs log group metrics
check online groups from the list
choose the graphed metric tab
for a statistic choose sum
for period choose 30 days
then from the add math drop down list
choose start with the empty expression
copy the following math expression and
paste it into the edit math expression
field then choose apply
choose the options Tab and then choose
number
at the top right of the graph choose
custom
then choose absolute select a start and
end date that corresponds with the last
30 days
you can now see the incoming bytes of
all log groups
you can graph up to 500 metrics using
this method query a large set of log
groups using an API call to query a
large set of groups using an API call
you can use AWS Cloud shell or your own
command line console
I am going to use cloud shell to open
Cloud show choose this icon
create the file log group incoming
bytes.json using your favorite text
editor
copy the following text lines
now run the following command and set
the timestamp according to your needs
the output shows the log group's names
now that the values are in bytes
review your storage data usage
go to the billing console
on the left menu select bills
then choose the month you want to
validate on the day drop menu
on AWS service charge on full Cloud
watch service you will see the cost by
region
unfold the region you want to validate
and you can see the log data ingested
cost
now you know how to find the log group
that is causing a sudden increase in
your Amazon cloudwatch logs Bill and
validate cloudwatch charges through the
months
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at AWS
